<!-- This file is not intended to serve as a complete backup of your site. -->

<!-- To import this information into a WordPress site follow these steps: -->
<!-- 1. Log in to that site as an administrator. -->
<!-- 2. Go to Tools: Import in the WordPress admin panel. -->
<!-- 3. Install the "WordPress" importer from the list. -->
<!-- 4. Activate & Run Importer. -->
<!-- 5. Upload this file using the form provided on that page. -->
<!-- 6. You will first be asked to map the authors in this export file to users -->
<!--    on the site. For each author, you may choose to map to an -->
<!--    existing user on the site or to create a new user. -->
<!-- 7. WordPress will then import each of the posts, pages, comments, categories, etc. -->
<!--    contained in this file into your site. -->

	<item>
		<title>Starting a subscription</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/account-and-billing/billing-and-plans/starting-a-subscription-3/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 22 Nov 2017 12:34:42 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Starting-a-subscription-1.mp4</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>225</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2017-11-22 12:34:42]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2017-11-22 12:34:42]]></wp:post_date_gmt>

	<item>

			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[a:5:{s:5:"width";i:1400;s:6:"height";i:948;s:4:"file";s:18:"Add-picture@2x.png";s:5:"sizes";a:5:{s:9:"thumbnail";a:4:{s:4:"file";s:26:"Add-picture-150x150@2x.png";s:5:"width";i:300;s:6:"height";i:300;s:9:"mime-type";s:9:"image/png";}s:6:"medium";a:4:{s:4:"file";s:26:"Add-picture-300x203@2x.png";s:5:"width";i:600;s:6:"height";i:406;s:9:"mime-type";s:9:"image/png";}s:5:"large";a:4:{s:4:"file";s:26:"Add-picture-700x474@2x.png";s:5:"width";i:1400;s:6:"height";i:948;s:9:"mime-type";s:9:"image/png";}s:10:"card-thumb";a:4:{s:4:"file";s:26:"Add-picture-205x139@2x.png";s:5:"width";i:410;s:6:"height";i:278;s:9:"mime-type";s:9:"image/png";}s:13:"card-thumb-2x";a:4:{s:4:"file";s:26:"Add-picture-410x278@2x.png";s:5:"width";i:820;s:6:"height";i:556;s:9:"mime-type";s:9:"image/png";}}s:10:"image_meta";a:12:{s:8:"aperture";s:1:"0";s:6:"credit";s:0:"";s:6:"camera";s:0:"";s:7:"caption";s:0:"";s:17:"created_timestamp";s:1:"0";s:9:"copyright";s:0:"";s:12:"focal_length";s:1:"0";s:3:"iso";s:1:"0";s:13:"shutter_speed";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:0:"";s:11:"orientation";s:1:"0";s:8:"keywords";a:0:{}}}]]></wp:meta_value>

		<title>Effects</title>

	<item>
		<title>Step</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/animation/steps/step/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 30 Nov 2017 17:45:42 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Step.mp4</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[]]></content:encoded>

			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_rm_attachment_metadata]]></wp:meta_key>

	<item>
		<title>Page</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/workspace/page/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 31 Oct 2017 15:35:05 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[wp-admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=23</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Creating a project in Editor is similar to designing a layout in Adobe Photoshop or Sketch. You can arrange widgets freely on the page. Any new project is created with a blank page and two default widgets, <a v-rlink="" href="/editor/#background">Background</a> and <a v-rlink="" href="/editor/#grid-guides">Grid &amp; Guides</a>, in Widgets (Q) panel.</p>


[img w="700" h="474" f="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Background-and-Grid-_-Guides.png" rf="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Background-and-Grid-_-Guides@2x.png" ]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>

	<item>
		<title>Widget bar</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/workspace/widget-bar/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 02 Nov 2017 14:04:58 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[wp-admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=25</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>The widget bar is located in the bottom left corner of the workspace and contains Layouts selector, which also allows you to change a height of the page, Undo/Redo button, and Widgets (Q) panel, that contains all your widgets.</p>


[img w="700" h="474" f="/wp-content/uploads/Layouts_-Undo_Redo.png" rf="/wp-content/uploads/Layouts_-Undo_Redo@2x.png" ]
[hint title="Hint: custom code works in Preview on all plans."]
<p>&nbsp;</p>
[/hint]]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Project Menu</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/workspace/project-menu/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 02 Nov 2017 14:09:17 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[wp-admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=27</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Click Project Menu (M) in the top right corner of the workspace, where you can:</p>
<ul>
	<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Rearrange and duplicate pages</span></li>
	<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Archive and restore archived pages</span></li>
	<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Add blank page or a page from the template</span></li>
	<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Create your page templates</span></li>
	<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Access project settings</span></li>
</ul>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<title>sharing</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/project-settings-and-publishing/adjust-page-appearance-in-search-and-social-media/sharing-2/</link>

	<item>
		<title>teamwork</title>

			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_rm_attachment_metadata]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[a:5:{s:5:"width";i:1400;s:6:"height";i:1158;s:4:"file";s:13:"export@2x.png";s:5:"sizes";a:5:{s:9:"thumbnail";a:4:{s:4:"file";s:21:"export-150x150@2x.png";s:5:"width";i:300;s:6:"height";i:300;s:9:"mime-type";s:9:"image/png";}s:6:"medium";a:4:{s:4:"file";s:21:"export-300x248@2x.png";s:5:"width";i:600;s:6:"height";i:496;s:9:"mime-type";s:9:"image/png";}s:5:"large";a:4:{s:4:"file";s:21:"export-700x579@2x.png";s:5:"width";i:1400;s:6:"height";i:1158;s:9:"mime-type";s:9:"image/png";}s:10:"card-thumb";a:4:{s:4:"file";s:21:"export-205x170@2x.png";s:5:"width";i:410;s:6:"height";i:340;s:9:"mime-type";s:9:"image/png";}s:13:"card-thumb-2x";a:4:{s:4:"file";s:21:"export-410x339@2x.png";s:5:"width";i:820;s:6:"height";i:678;s:9:"mime-type";s:9:"image/png";}}s:10:"image_meta";a:12:{s:8:"aperture";s:1:"0";s:6:"credit";s:0:"";s:6:"camera";s:0:"";s:7:"caption";s:0:"";s:17:"created_timestamp";s:1:"0";s:9:"copyright";s:0:"";s:12:"focal_length";s:1:"0";s:3:"iso";s:1:"0";s:13:"shutter_speed";s:1:"0";s:5:"title";s:0:"";s:11:"orientation";s:1:"0";s:8:"keywords";a:0:{}}}]]></wp:meta_value>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[To see how your project will appear published, click Preview (P) in the top right corner at any time. The same button will return you to Edit (P) mode.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Templates</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/workspace/project-menu/templates/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 02 Nov 2017 14:12:59 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[wp-admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=30</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Templates are pre-designed pages. You can save any page from your project as a template. They appear in My Templates collection, accessible through Add Page menu in all your projects. You can also select multiple ready-to-use Microsites, Presentations, Photo Stories, and Longreads in R/m Templates.</p>


[img w="700" h="474" f="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Templates.png" rf="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Templates@2x.png" ]

<p>Templates allow you to transfer pages between projects. Save the page as a template, switch to a different project, and add this page from the newly created template. </p>
<p>Note! Some types of content and attributes are not saved in templates: paragraphs, link styles and fixed On All Pages widgets.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>30</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2017-11-02 14:12:59]]></wp:post_date>

	<item>
		<title>Project Settings</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/workspace/project-menu/project-settings/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 02 Nov 2017 14:42:39 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[wp-admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=33</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Click Project Settings beside your project’s title to access General, Privacy, Domain, and Viewer attributes. Here you can change the title, description, URL, and public visibility of your project, use Code Embedding to add custom scripts in your project’s HTML header, set password protection and custom domain name, hide standard interface elements, change viewer options and publish your project when it’s ready.</p>


[img w="700" h="474" f="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Project-Settings.png" rf="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Project-Settings@2x.png" ]

<p>Read more about <a v-rlink="" href="/project-settings-and-publishing/">Project Settings and Publishing</a>.</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Dotted Frame</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/workspace/dotted-frame/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 02 Nov 2017 14:48:51 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[wp-admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=36</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>To correctly appear on all screens, the content on your page (including sticky and fixed widgets) should always fit within 1024 px wide area, marked with a dotted frame. A widget outside the dotted frame may not appear on small screens.</p>


[img w="700" h="437" f="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Dotted-frame_1X.png" rf="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Dotted-frame_1X@2x.png" ]

<p>By default, content on the desktop is centred and never scaled. The mobile layout of your page is always scaled and centred to fit the screen width.</p>
<p>Read more about <a v-rlink="" href="/editor/#positioning">Positioning</a> widgets and <a v-rlink="" href="/editor/#mobile-layout">Mobile layouts</a>.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Widgets panel</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/widgets/widgets-panel/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 02 Nov 2017 15:01:14 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[wp-admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=42</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>When you add a new widget, it appears in Widgets (Q) panel on the widget bar. Think of widgets as layers in any graphics editor — you can freely move and resize them, change their opacity, align and group several widgets together, and arrange them by placing above or underneath each other. To move your widget around the page, simply click and drag it to a new position.</p>


[img w="700" h="474" f="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Widgets.png" rf="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Widgets@2x.png" ]

<p>If you hover over a widget in the panel, two icons appear: eye and lock. The Eye makes your widget invisible, while Lock (L) allows you to pin it down on the page.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>42</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2017-11-02 15:01:14]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2017-11-02 15:01:14]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[widgets-panel]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>39</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>15</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[card]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>

		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_rm_card_attributes]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[a:0:{}]]></wp:meta_value>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Operations with widgets</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/widgets/operations-with-widgets/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 17 Nov 2017 14:40:49 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[wp-admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=53</guid>

	<item>
		<title>Basic positioning</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/widgets/operations-with-widgets/basic-positioning/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 17 Nov 2017 14:41:20 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[wp-admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=54</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Positions of your widgets are described in absolute values, and they remain at the exact same place regardless of the screen size. You can move widgets freely around your workspace.</p>
<p>By default, each widget should be placed within the dotted frame to ensure it will appear on all screens.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>54</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2017-11-17 14:41:20]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2017-11-17 14:41:20]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[basic-positioning]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>53</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[card]]></wp:post_type>

		</wp:postmeta>
	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Widget controls</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/widgets/operations-with-widgets/widget-controls/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 17 Nov 2017 14:46:35 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[wp-admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=55</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Widget controls appear on the right side of the workspace each time you click one of the widgets. Slightly varying for different types of widgets, this panel contains all attributes of the widget. <span style="font-weight: 400;">Most common operations allow you to:</span></p>
<ul>
	<li><span style="font-weight: 400;">Adjust widget settings</span></li>
	<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Rotate the widget</span></li>
	<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Add animation</span></li>
	<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Scale to original size</span></li>
	<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Lock the widget</span></li>
	<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Group / Ungroup several widgets</span></li>
	<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Align widgets on the page</span></li>
	<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Position, fix, and 'stick' your widgets</span></li>
	<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Arrange widgets above each other</span></li>
	<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Turn widget into a link</span></li>
</ul>
<p>[video src="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/widget-controls.mp4" width="700" height="437" autoplay=on loop=on controls=off]</p>


[hint title="Hint: working with widgets."]
<ol>
	<li>Copy and paste are available across all your projects: copy any widget, open a different project, and paste it there.</li>
	<li>Alt + drag allows you to instantly create a copy of the widget and place it on the page beside the original.</li>
	<li>Shift + drag moves the widget only along horizontal and vertical axes. See also <a v-rlink="" href="/editor/#grid-guides">Snap</a> function.</li>
	<li>Bundle drag: use a triangle under the widget's frame to simultaneously move the widget and everything below it. Works in two modes:<br />
 <span style="font-weight: 400;">F + drag moves all widgets below the top edge of the selected widget;<br />
 </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">V + drag moves all widgets below the bottom edge of the selected widget.</span></li>
	<li>Activate Sizes (X) function to see the exact dimensions of any selected widget in pixels. Type in a specific width or height to resize it.</li>
</ol>
[/hint]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>55</wp:post_id>

		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[widget-controls]]></wp:post_name>

	<item>
		<title>Position control</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/positioning/position-control/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 17 Nov 2017 14:49:27 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[wp-admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=59</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Click Position in your widget controls to change positioning attributes of your widget:</p>
<ul>
	<li>Fix your widget to the edge of the page;</li>
	<li>Position your widget pinned on Top, Right, Left, or Bottom of the page;</li>
	<li>Stretch Full-Width widget along the screen;</li>
	<li>Create On All Pages widgets automatically;</li>
	<li>Place your widget Above Pages.
[img w="700" h="474" f="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Position-control.png" rf="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Position-control@2x.png" ]</li>
</ul>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Widgets fixed to the edge</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/positioning/widgets-fixed-to-the-edge/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 17 Nov 2017 15:21:19 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[wp-admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=60</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>These widgets are always ‘fixed’ to one of the edges, a corner, or a centre of the screen, regardless a browser’s window size. If the page is scrolled down, a fixed widget will remain on your visitor’s screen and follow the scroll throughout a current page.</p>
<p>[video src="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/fixed.mp4" width="700" height="437" autoplay=on loop=on controls=off]</p>
<p>Fixed widgets only appear if they are arranged above or below all other widgets on the page. Use Widgets (Q) panel to arrange a fixed widget in front or in the back, if necessary.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>60</wp:post_id>

		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>

	<item>
		<title>Widgets pinned to the edge</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/positioning/widgets-pinned-to-the-edge/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 17 Nov 2017 15:22:33 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[wp-admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=61</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>These widgets remain pinned to the Top and Bottom edge of the page or to the Left/Right edge of the screen. Select one of the options in Position panel. If the page is scrolled down, a pinned widget will remain with the rest of the content above your visitor's current screen. On every page of your project, a pinned widget is placed at the same distance from the edge.</p>
<p>Note! When you create a mobile layout for the page, Fix and Position attributes are not transferred from the desktop layout.</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Stretchable widgets</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/positioning/stretchable-widgets/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 17 Nov 2017 15:22:54 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[wp-admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=62</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>These widgets appear stretched across the entire screen by default, or within a specific Margin you set. Click Full Width oval selector in the centre of Position panel to stretch your widget.</p>
<p>[video src="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/full-width.mp4" width="700" height="437" autoplay=on loop=on controls=off]</p>
<p>Note! Widgets are only stretchable in width, but not in height.</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Types of animation</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/animation/types-of-animation/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 17 Nov 2017 15:26:47 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[wp-admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=66</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Click Animation in your widget controls and choose one of the four types of animation in the desktop layout of your page, triggered by different actions:</p>
<ul>
	<li>On Load starts once the page is loaded in a browser;</li>
	<li>On Click requires your visitor to click or tap on the widget;</li>
	<li>On Hover starts when your visitor moves their mouse over the widget;</li>
	<li>On Scroll starts in a specified position on the page and follows the scrolling.</li>
</ul>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">In the mobile layout, only On Click and On Load animations are available.</span></p>
<p>Note! When you create the mobile layout, animation attributes are not transferred from the desktop layout, even for supported On Click and On Load types.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>66</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2017-11-17 15:26:47]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2017-11-17 15:26:47]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[types-of-animation]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>65</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[card]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>

		</wp:postmeta>

	<item>
		<title>Effects</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/animation/effects/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 17 Nov 2017 15:27:15 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[wp-admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=67</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Four basic effects are available for your animation — Move, Opacity, Rotate and Scale. Use one of the existing Presets as is, customize them by changing parameters and adding more effects, or build your own sequence of basic effects from the scratch.</p>


[img w="700" h="474" f="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Effects.png" rf="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Effects@2x.png" ]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>67</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2017-11-17 15:27:15]]></wp:post_date>

		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[effects]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>65</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[card]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>

			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[a:0:{}]]></wp:meta_value>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Steps</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/animation/steps/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 17 Nov 2017 15:28:39 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[wp-admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=68</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>You can add multiple steps to the animation by clicking Add Step below the widget. Step 1 is created automatically, once you choose the initial Effect or Preset in the Animation control.</p>
<p>For each step of On Load, On Click and On Hover animations you can set the delay, duration and acceleration.</p>
<p>[video src="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Step.mp4" width="700" height="437" autoplay=on loop=on controls=off]</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>68</wp:post_id>

	<item>
		<title>On Load animation — Start When in View</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/animation/steps/on-load-animation-start-when-in-view/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 17 Nov 2017 15:29:16 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[wp-admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=69</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>By default, On Load animation starts as soon as the page finishes loading, while some widgets might not yet be visible. Use Start When in View control to delay animation until the widget actually appears on your visitor's screen.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>69</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2017-11-17 15:29:16]]></wp:post_date>

	<item>
		<title>On Scroll animation — Start Point</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/animation/steps/on-scroll-animation-start-point/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 17 Nov 2017 15:29:43 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[wp-admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=70</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>You can choose Start Point for your On Scroll animation, and it will start once the top edge of the widget is aligned with Top, Center, or Bottom (by default) of the screen. Offset allows you to set the Start Point at the exact height in pixels.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>On Scroll animation — Speed</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/animation/steps/on-scroll-animation-speed/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 17 Nov 2017 15:30:10 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[wp-admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=71</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>This attribute allows you to specify acceleration. By changing Speed, you can define how long each step of your On Scroll animation is displayed while the visitor is scrolling the page. If you set the Speed to 1x, the animation step will be displayed for the duration of scrolling the page by one pixel. With the Speed of 0.5x — by two pixels. The faster the speed of your animation, the less your visitor has to scroll to play it.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>71</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2017-11-17 15:30:10]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2017-11-17 15:30:10]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[on-scroll-animation-speed]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>

	<item>
		<title>On Click / On Hover animation — Add Trigger</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/animation/steps/on-click-on-hover-animation-add-trigger/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 17 Nov 2017 15:31:38 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[wp-admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=72</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>By default, On Click and On Hover animation starts when your visitor interacts with the animated widget itself. You can also set any other widget on the page as a trigger. Click Add Trigger in Animation control, and select any widget. Once your visitor’s cursor touches the trigger, the animation starts for the initial widget.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Animating multiple widgets</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/animation/animating-multiple-widgets/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 17 Nov 2017 15:32:28 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[wp-admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=74</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>You can simultaneously animate more than one widget. Select all necessary widgets with Shift + click, and then proceed with Animation control as usual. All changes will be identically applied to each individual widget in the selection.</p>
<p>If you select a mix of animated and regular widgets, you will be prompted to merge different animations, so that each selected widget has identical attributes.</p>
<p>Note! Full-width, fixed and sticky widgets (see <a v-rlink="" href="/editor/#positioning">Positioning</a>) cannot be animated together or with regular widgets.</p>


[hint title="Hint: copy animation effects."]
<p>Use Shift + Cmd + C/V to copy animation effects from one widget and apply them to others.</p>
[/hint]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>74</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2017-11-17 15:32:28]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2017-11-17 15:32:28]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>

		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[animating-multiple-widgets]]></wp:post_name>

[img w="700" h="474" f="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Links.png" rf="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Links@2x.png" ]]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Link types</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/links/link-types/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 17 Nov 2017 15:36:56 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[wp-admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=76</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<ul>
	<li><strong>Website URL.</strong> Link to an external website.</li>
	<li><strong>Jump to Page.</strong> Link to any page within the project. Type in the page number or page custom link. These links are updated automatically when you rearrange pages in the project.</li>
	<li><strong>Email.</strong> Standard ’mailto’ URI scheme that creates a new email message to a specified address.</li>
	<li><strong>Phone Number.</strong> ‘Tel’ URI scheme that allows starting a call on mobile devices. The number has up to fifteen digits without spaces, hyphens and separators: +[country code][national destination (area) code][subscriber number], as per E.164 recommendations.</li>
	<li><strong>Anchor.</strong> Link to any particular position on the same page. Click anywhere to set your anchor, or type in height in pixels, e.g. 748 px. The anchor can’t be placed on the different page.</li>
	<li><strong>Scroll to Top.</strong> Brings your visitor to the top of the page.</li>
	<li><strong>Go Back.</strong> Leads to the previous page of the project.</li>
</ul>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>76</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2017-11-17 15:36:56]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2017-11-17 15:36:56]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[link-types]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>75</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[card]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>

	<item>
		<title>Scalable desktop layout</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/adaptive-design/scalable-desktop-layout/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 17 Nov 2017 15:37:59 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[wp-admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=78</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Note! This feature is still in development.</p>
<p>Click Scale Layout control on the Viewer tab in <a v-rlink="" href="/editor/#project-settings">Project Settings</a> to automatically scale the content within the dotted frame to the width of a desktop browser window.</p>


[img w="700" h="474" f="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Scale-Layout.png" rf="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Scale-Layout@2x.png" ]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Mobile layout</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/adaptive-design/mobile-layout/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 17 Nov 2017 15:38:14 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[wp-admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=79</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>79</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2017-11-17 15:38:14]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2017-11-17 15:38:14]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[mobile-layout]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>77</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[card]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Layouts panel</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/adaptive-design/mobile-layout/layouts-panel/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 17 Nov 2017 15:39:05 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[wp-admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=80</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>To create a mobile layout for the page, toggle the switch in Layouts panel on your widget bar. By default, the scaled desktop layout is displayed for all pages on screens less than 1024 px in width.</p>


[img w="700" h="474" f="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Mobile-layouts.png" rf="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Mobile-layouts@2x.png" ]

<p>We recommend creating the mobile layout only after the desktop layout of the page is completely finished — it will save a lot of time.</p>


[hint title="Hint: mobile layout details."]
<ul>
	<li>Use the keyboard to switch between desktop (1) and mobile (2) layouts both in Edit and Preview modes.</li>
	<li>Mobile layout is always 320 px in width. You can change the height of the page in Layouts panel.</li>
	<li>Only two types of animation are available: On Load and On Click.</li>
</ul>
[/hint]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>80</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2017-11-17 15:39:05]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2017-11-17 15:39:05]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[layouts-panel]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>79</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[card]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>

		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_rm_card_attributes]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[a:0:{}]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Widgets in desktop and mobile layout</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/adaptive-design/mobile-layout/widgets-in-desktop-and-mobile-layout/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 17 Nov 2017 15:40:35 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[wp-admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=81</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Mobile layouts are created for each page of the project individually — you rearrange and reconfigure the same widgets within 320 px dotted frame to show your visitors with smartphones and tablets an adapted version of the page instead of the automatically scaled desktop layout.</p>
<p>The content of all your widgets is synchronized between desktop and mobile layouts, so any changes to the text, pictures, links or videos appear in both versions. However, you position your widgets within the dotted frame and change their attributes, such as size, colour, rotation, opacity, font styles and animations, independently in the desktop (1024 px) and mobile (320 px) layout.</p>
<p>Any widget exists in both layouts. When you add a new widget to the mobile layout, it is created as hidden on the desktop. To alter the content between two layouts, e.g. to create different texts for desktop and smartphone visitors, you can copy the widget, edit it separately, and then hide the duplicate both on the desktop and mobile layout. If you turn the mobile layout off in Layouts panel, position and attributes of your widgets will remain separated from the desktop version.</p>
<p>Note! When you create the mobile layout, all animated widgets will appear static. Use Shift+Cmd+C/V to copy animation attributes from On Click and On Load desktop widgets, and paste them to your mobile widget.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>81</wp:post_id>

		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>

	<item>
		<title>Desktop vs. mobile layout on different screens</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/adaptive-design/mobile-layout/desktop-vs-mobile-layout-on-different-screens/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 17 Nov 2017 15:41:47 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[wp-admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=82</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>If you create both the desktop (1024 px) and mobile (325 px) layouts of the page, the one closest to the actual screen width of the particular device will be displayed. Layouts also change when the mobile device is rotated from portrait to landscape view.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Mobile layout and responsiveness</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/adaptive-design/mobile-layout/mobile-layout-and-responsiveness/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 17 Nov 2017 15:43:35 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[wp-admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=83</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Some web publishing tools, such as Squarespace or Wix, support responsive design — the page is rendered as a whole, different for each particular screen size. All objects are described as fragments of code in the template, following the single ‘flow’ and appearing on the screen one after another.</p>
<p>Readymag operates under the more intuitive WYSIWYG model. The content on your page is organized in separate widgets, and you can move them freely around the workspace, similar to layers in Adobe Photoshop or Sketch. A position of your widgets is described in absolute values, and they have constant attributes regardless of the screen size.</p>
<p>Our Editor gives you full control over the mobile layout that will appear on your visitor’s screen, rather than relying on the rendering mechanism of their browser to re-create your page differently in response to the detected screen size.</p>


[hint title="Hint: relative position."]
<p>Some widgets can be positioned relative to a screen size. Read more about sticky and fixed widgets in <a v-rlink="" href="/editor/#positioning">Positioning</a>.</p>
[/hint]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>83</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2017-11-17 15:43:35]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2017-11-17 15:43:35]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[mobile-layout-and-responsiveness]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>79</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[card]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>

	<item>
		<title>Publish and update</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/project-settings-and-publishing/publish-and-update-instantly/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 17 Nov 2017 15:47:59 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[wp-admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=84</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Publishing a project takes just one click. Once you’ve published your project, you will have a direct URL, as well as Facebook, Twitter, and Email buttons for a quick sharing. Click Unpublish to hide your project from the visitors.</p>
<p>The public version of your project is separated from the one you can edit. If you update the published project, it will have Unpublished Changes status in the Project Menu (M). To show updated version to your visitors, click Republish button in Project Settings.</p>


[hint title="Hint: publish (republish) button is also available in Preview (P) mode."]
<p>&nbsp;</p>
[/hint]]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Navigation</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/project-settings-and-publishing/viewer-and-navigation/navigation/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 20 Nov 2017 16:34:14 +0000</pubDate>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=117</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Change the scrolling direction for your project: pages will follow each other in Horizontal or Vertical orientation. If you don't want pages to follow each other, switch to Horizontal orientation and turn off Navigation arrows. The same attributes are necessary if you want to create a project with custom navigation.</p>]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Slide-in transition</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/project-settings-and-publishing/viewer-and-navigation/slide-in-transition/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 20 Nov 2017 16:36:04 +0000</pubDate>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>This attribute allows the next page of your project to appear on top of the current one. </p>
<p>[video src="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Slide-in-transition.mp4" width="700" height="437" autoplay=on loop=on controls=off]</p>
<p>Note! Slide-in transition option may slow down projects with heavy animation.</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Default navigation elements</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/project-settings-and-publishing/viewer-and-navigation/default-navigation-elements/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 20 Nov 2017 16:36:43 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=119</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>You can hide any standard interface elements:</p>
<ul>
	<li>Navigation arrows. Hiding arrows also disable turning pages with the continuous scroll in Horizontal scrolling mode.</li>
	<li>Menu button in the top right corner of the page</li>
	<li>Project info </li>
	<li>Share button</li>
	<li>Page Counter</li>
	<li>Endpage — a default pop-up panel with social buttons that appears after the last page. You can disable the end page, show only project info, or add Readymag promo and your latest projects.</li>
</ul>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Scalable layout (beta)</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/project-settings-and-publishing/viewer-and-navigation/scalable-layout-beta/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 20 Nov 2017 16:37:10 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=120</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Click Scale Layout<sup>β</sup> to automatically scale the content within the dotted frame to the width of your visitor's browser window. This attribute applies only to the desktop layout. Please remember, the feature is still in development.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>120</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2017-11-20 16:37:10]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2017-11-20 16:37:10]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[scalable-layout-beta]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>116</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[card]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_rm_card_attributes]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[a:1:{s:12:"output_level";i:4;}]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Custom domain name</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/project-settings-and-publishing/use-custom-domain-name/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 20 Nov 2017 16:38:50 +0000</pubDate>

		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">You can use custom domain instead of a default Readymag URL for any of your projects, as well as map a domain to your whole profile.</span></p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Custom domain name for a project</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/project-settings-and-publishing/use-custom-domain-name/custom-domain-name/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 20 Nov 2017 16:41:28 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=122</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Map the domain magazine.brand.com to your project:</p>
<ul>
	<li>https://magazine.brand.com/ opens the project's homepage.</li>
	<li>https://help.readymag.com/contents-page/ and similar links open specific pages within the project.</li>
</ul>
<p>Two or more projects cannot share the same domain name.</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Custom domain for profile page</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/project-settings-and-publishing/use-custom-domain-name/custom-domain-for-profile-page/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 20 Nov 2017 16:42:03 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=123</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Map the domain profile.brand.com to your Readymag profile:</p>
<ul>
	<li>https://profile.brand.com/ opens the public Readymag profile page. This page cannot be customized, but you can sort your projects in Public and Private folders, and hide any of them by turning off the Show this project on my profile page control on Privacy tab in the Project Settings.</li>
	<li>https://profile.brand.com/project-name/ opens a specific project. You can set the project Link on General tab in your Project Settings.</li>
	<li>https://profile.brand.com/project-name/page/ opens a specific page in the project. You can set this Link on SEO tab in your page Settings.</li>
</ul>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<title>Before you start</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/project-settings-and-publishing/use-custom-domain-name/before-you-start/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 20 Nov 2017 16:43:13 +0000</pubDate>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<ol>
	<li><a v-rlink href="https://iwantmyname.com/services/social/readymag-custom-domain">Purchase</a> a new domain.</li>
	<li>If you already own a domain name, make sure you have full access to DNS settings in your domain's administrative console.</li>
</ol>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>More about DNS</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/project-settings-and-publishing/use-custom-domain-name/before-you-start/more-about-dns/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 20 Nov 2017 16:43:31 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=125</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>In order to change DNS settings, you need to have name servers (NS) assigned to your domain. In most cases, you can simply use the default name servers provided by your domain registrar.</p>
<p>Your provider must offer full DNS access in order to map a custom domain to Readymag. You can transfer the purchased domain from the initial registrar to any other domain provider if necessary.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>125</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2017-11-20 16:43:31]]></wp:post_date>

	<item>
		<title>Step 1: Configure domain name</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/project-settings-and-publishing/use-custom-domain-name/step-1-configure-domain-name/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 20 Nov 2017 16:44:41 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=126</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>126</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2017-11-20 16:44:41]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2017-11-20 16:44:41]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[step-1-configure-domain-name]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>121</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[card]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[2]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_rm_card_attributes]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[a:0:{}]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Connect an existing domain to Readymag</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/project-settings-and-publishing/use-custom-domain-name/step-1-configure-domain-name/connect-an-existing-domain-to-readymag/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 20 Nov 2017 16:45:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=127</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<ol>
	<li>Find DNS settings in the administrative panel of your domain provider.</li>
	<li>Create DNS records for each domain name that you want to use with Readymag.</li>
</ol>
<h4 class="single-page__header-4">Second-level domain name: yourdomain.com</h4>
<table>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td style="width: 20%;">Host</td>
<td style="width: 20%;">Type</td>
<td>Point To (Value)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="width: 20%;">@</td>
<td style="width: 20%;">A</td>
<td>54.194.41.141</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<h4 class="single-page__header-4">Subdomain: www.yourdomain.com</h4>
<table>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td style="width: 20%;">Host</td>
<td style="width: 20%;">Type</td>
<td>Point To (Value)</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="width: 20%;">www</td>
<td style="width: 20%;">CNAME</td>
<td>domains.readymag.com</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">In the Host field for a subdomain record, you need to specify the part of the domain name before the second dot from the end, e.g.</span></p>
<ul>
	<li><span style="font-weight: 400;">if the subdomain name is bar.yourdomain.com, type in ‘bar’;</span></li>
	<li><span style="font-weight: 400;">if the subdomain name is foo.bar.yourdomain.com, enter ‘foo.bar’ in this field.</span></li>
</ul>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;"> Depending on the provider, you may already have some existing A records for your domain. Make sure there is only one record with A Type and @ Host matching the values above left.</span></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">If you have any email service connected to your custom domain, such as G Suite and Yandex.Connect, make sure to delete any MX records associated with it.</span></p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>127</wp:post_id>

		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[connect-an-existing-domain-to-readymag]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>126</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[card]]></wp:post_type>

		</wp:postmeta>

	<item>
		<title>Purchase a ready-to-use domain</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/project-settings-and-publishing/use-custom-domain-name/step-1-configure-domain-name/purchase-a-ready-to-use-domain/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 20 Nov 2017 16:45:30 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=128</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Visit <a v-rlink href="https://iwantmyname.com/services/social/readymag-custom-domain">‘I Want My Name’</a> domain service to purchase a domain name that already has A record set for Readymag. After that, you can proceed to <a v-rlink href="/project-settings-and-publishing/#step-2-wait-and-test">Step 2</a>.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Step 2: Wait and test</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/project-settings-and-publishing/use-custom-domain-name/step-2-wait-and-test/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 20 Nov 2017 16:45:57 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=129</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>If all DNS records are entered correctly, your domain will be connected to Readymag servers within a couple hours. This process may take up to 72 hours. Check here for progress at any time.</p>
<p>Once the domain is correctly linked, you will be able to use it on Readymag – proceed to Step 3. Otherwise, check DNS settings again or contact your domain provider's support.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Step 3: Map domain</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/project-settings-and-publishing/use-custom-domain-name/step-3-map-domain/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 20 Nov 2017 16:46:21 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=130</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>&nbsp;</p>
<table class="two-column-description">
<thead>
<tr>
<td>To a profile page</td>
<td>To a project</td>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>Open your Readymag profile, click Edit Profile button, and select Domain (<a v-rlink="" href="https://my.readymag.com/settings/domain">link&nbsp;to&nbsp;profile</a>).</td>
<td>Open your Project Settings and click Domain tab.</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p>Type in your domain name and press Test. If the domain is configured correctly, Map Now button will appear. Click it to complete the process, or return to the previous steps to change your domain's A Record.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Mapping a domain with www.domain alias</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/project-settings-and-publishing/use-custom-domain-name/step-3-map-domain/mapping-a-domain-with-www-domain-alias/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 20 Nov 2017 16:46:40 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=131</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>It is recommended to create an additional CNAME record for a www subdomain when you're mapping a custom domain name to Readymag, as illustrated in the Step 1. This way, if your visitor opens a browser and types in https://yourdomain.com without 'www,' it will still resolve to the right server for your project.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>131</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2017-11-20 16:46:40]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2017-11-20 16:46:40]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>

	<item>
		<title>SSL certificate</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/project-settings-and-publishing/use-custom-domain-name/ssl-certificate/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 20 Nov 2017 16:47:07 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=132</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>SSL Certificate provides privacy, critical security and data integrity for both your projects and your users' personal information. Having an SSL certificate installed on your project positively affect its credibility and search engine rankings. Trusted indicators for a correctly installed and configured SSL certificate should be https:// in the address bar. Actually, https is the secure version of http, which is the protocol over which data is sent between a browser and a website. The ‘s’ at the end of https stands for ‘secure’ which means all exchanges of information between the browser and the site are encrypted.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>132</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2017-11-20 16:47:07]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2017-11-20 16:47:07]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[ssl-certificate]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>121</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[card]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>

	<item>
		<title>Password Protection</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/project-settings-and-publishing/set-password-and-hide-from-search-engines/password-protection/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 20 Nov 2017 16:47:45 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=134</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Create a password to make your project completely private. It won't be indexed by search engines and social networks, while any visitor with a direct URL will be prompted to enter the password to view your project. This way you can try it out on a limited audience before going public.</p>
<p>Click Password Protection switch, type in the desired combination, and press Save.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>134</wp:post_id>

	<item>
		<title>SEO</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/project-settings-and-publishing/adjust-page-appearance-in-search-and-social-media/seo/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 20 Nov 2017 16:49:12 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=138</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<ul>
	<li>Title. Specify the &lt;title&gt; tag of your page.</li>
	<li>Description. For the &lt;meta name="description"&gt; tag.</li>
	<li>Keywords. A list of keywords, separated by the comma, in the &lt;meta name="keywords"&gt; tag.</li>
	<li>Link. Direct URL that you can change to a specific page.</li>
</ul>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>138</wp:post_id>

	<item>
		<title>Sharing</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/project-settings-and-publishing/adjust-page-appearance-in-search-and-social-media/sharing/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 20 Nov 2017 16:49:32 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=139</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Add Open Graph tags to specify how your page will appear shared in a post on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Pinterest, and other social media platforms that support OG.</p>
<p>Click Customize to change default parameters:</p>
<ul>
	<li>Image. Upload an image to appear in the link preview instead of the autogenerated page miniature.</li>
	<li>Title. Specify the &lt;meta property="og:title"&gt; tag for your page.</li>
	<li>Description. For the &lt;meta property="og:description"&gt; tag.</li>
	<li>Tweet Message. Pre-composed text for Twitter widget and standard Readymag sharing buttons.</li>
</ul>
<p>Use these settings for all pages — allows you to automatically specify the same Open Graph meta tags for every page.</p>


[hint title="Hint: notify Facebook of the changes."]
<p>Facebook may not update your meta information immediately after you change it in the Editor. Use <a v-rlink="" href="https://developers.facebook.com/tools/debug/">Object Debugger</a> to notify of Facebook the changes in your Open Graph tags. </p>
[/hint]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>139</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2017-11-20 16:49:32]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2017-11-20 16:49:32]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[sharing]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>137</wp:post_parent>

	<item>
		<title>Google Analytics</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/project-settings-and-publishing/collect-data-about-visitors/google-analytics/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 20 Nov 2017 16:51:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=141</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Readymag has a built-in analytics tool, so you simply need to specify a unique tracking ID in your project's or profile settings. The Tracking ID is a string like UA-000000-2, used by Google Analytics to send all collected data to your account and property.</p>
<p>Read how to <a v-rlink href="https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/7372977?hl=en">Find your tracking ID</a> in Google Help.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>141</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2017-11-20 16:51:00]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2017-11-20 16:51:00]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[google-analytics]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>140</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[card]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[2]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_rm_card_attributes]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[a:0:{}]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Setting up GA account to get Tracking ID</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/project-settings-and-publishing/collect-data-about-visitors/google-analytics/setting-up-ga-account-to-get-tracking-id/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 20 Nov 2017 16:51:22 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=142</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Log in to your Google Account on <a v-rlink="" href="https://www.google.com/analytics/">this page</a> and create new Analytics account if necessary. Click Admin below the list of reports on the left, and select Create a new property in the drop-down menu in the second column.</p>
<p>Specify the required settings, and click Get Tracking ID. Please make sure to select https instead of http in Website URL drop-down. Copy Tracking ID which looks like UA-XXXXXXXX-Y, and return to Readymag settings.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>142</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2017-11-20 16:51:22]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2017-11-20 16:51:22]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>

		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>

	<item>
		<title>Option 1: Connect your profile</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/project-settings-and-publishing/collect-data-about-visitors/google-analytics/option-1-connect-your-profile/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 20 Nov 2017 16:51:51 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=143</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Open your Readymag profile, click Edit Profile button, and paste your Tracking ID into the Google Analytics field. Click Save Changes. Data collected across all your projects will be sent to one property in your Google Analytics account.</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Other analytics tools</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/project-settings-and-publishing/collect-data-about-visitors/other-analytics-tools/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 20 Nov 2017 16:52:35 +0000</pubDate>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>At the moment, only Google Analytics is officially supported. However, with the help of a fellow developer and <a v-rlink href="/custom-analytics-api/">Readymag API</a>, you can send data to other web analytics services.</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Custom code</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/project-settings-and-publishing/embed-custom-code/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 20 Nov 2017 16:53:13 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=146</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Click Code Embedding on the General tab in your Project Settings to open a code editor, where you can type in or paste a custom HTML, JavaScript, and CSS code for additional interactive forms, menus, styles, animation effects, and other customizations of your project.</p>
<p>Note! Any third-party script will likely require additional coding to make it work since Readymag has some very sophisticated mechanisms under the hood. We recommend inviting a professional web developer to work with  Code Embedding. Use any custom code at your own risk, and proceed with extreme caution — Readymag support won't be able to assist you with Project Code issues.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>CSS</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/project-settings-and-publishing/embed-custom-code/css/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 20 Nov 2017 16:53:58 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=148</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Switch to CSS tab to use an custom styles CSS for your project. The CSS code is applied to all pages. Please note, custom code fully works on the Professional and Enterprise plans, as well as in Preview (P) mode on all plans — this way you can test the functionality before upgrading.</p>
<p>If you want to execute your code locally within the project, e.g. to embed a customized video player or web application on one of the pages, use Widget Code in <a v-rlink="" href="/editor/#embed-code">Embed &amp; Code widget</a>.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Google Tag Manager</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/project-settings-and-publishing/embed-custom-code/google-tag-manager/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 20 Nov 2017 16:54:32 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=149</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Create and manage custom Google Tag Manager tags in your project: remarketing and conversion tracking, chat applications, and so on. Paste your container ID, which looks like GTM-XXXXXX, on Domain tab of your Project Settings:</p>
<p>Please note, Google Tag Manager feature is only available if you are using a custom domain name for the project.</p>
<p>Read more about setting up GTM account on <a v-rlink href="https://support.google.com/tagmanager/answer/6103696">Google Help.</a></p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Profile settings</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/account-and-billing/profile-settings/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 21 Nov 2017 14:20:23 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=150</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Click <a v-rlink="" href="https://my.readymag.com/settings/profile">Edit Profile</a> button to access Settings.</p>
<p>In the main Profile section you can customize your Readymag public profile page: set Userpic, Name, and Location, specify and change custom URL in Username field, add Bio and links to your website, Twitter, and Facebook accounts. Use Google Analytics field to specify a unique Tracking ID if you want to collect data from all projects in one property in your GA account.</p>
<p>[video src="/wp-content/uploads/Profile-Settings.mp4" width="700" height="393" autoplay=on loop=on controls=off]</p>
<p>Read how to Collect data about visitors to find out more about built-in <a v-rlink="" href="http://help-test.readymag.net/card/account-and-billing/downgrading/after-downgrading/google-analytics/">Google Analytics</a> and Tracking ID.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Password &amp; Email</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/account-and-billing/profile-settings/password-email/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 21 Nov 2017 14:20:53 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=151</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>You can change Current Email and set New Password for your account. Click Save Changes after updating Password &amp; Email, and then use Logout to re-enter Readymag with new credentials. </p>
<p>If you can't change the email, make sure there is no other Readymag account associated with your New Email. Only one account can be associated with each email address.</p>


[img w="700" h="474" f="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Password-_-Email.png" rf="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Password-_-Email@2x.png" ]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>151</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2017-11-21 14:20:53]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2017-11-21 14:20:53]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[password-email]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>150</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[card]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_rm_card_attributes]]></wp:meta_key>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Subscription &amp; Billing</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/account-and-billing/profile-settings/subscription-billing/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 21 Nov 2017 14:21:22 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=152</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Control your Current Plan and payments. For more information, see <a v-rlink="" href="http://help-test.readymag.net/card/account-and-billing/billing-and-plans/">Billing and plans</a> below.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>

		<title>Menu panel</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/account-and-billing/menu-panel/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 21 Nov 2017 14:23:06 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=155</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>When you're logged in and browsing Readymag website beyond your profile page or a specific published project, a fixed Menu panel at the bottom of the screen provides quick access to your Readymag profile, Settings, Logout, as well as Support, R/m Newsletter, and Privacy &amp; Terms. Create button instantly opens a new project in the Editor.</p>


[img w="700" h="474" f="/wp-content/uploads/Menu-panel.png" rf="/wp-content/uploads/Menu-panel@2x.png" ]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Project folders</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/account-and-billing/project-folders/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 21 Nov 2017 14:23:24 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=156</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>You can organize your projects in folders on the profile page. Click Select above the list of your projects, specify one or more projects you want to move, pick a destination folder in New Folder drop-down, and click Move.</p>
<p>Alternatively, you can use Move to Folder in the Preview Project drop-down, visible when you hover over a project's cover.</p>
<p>Move your cursor over the folder, and click to customize it. Type in or paste a name, switch from Public to Private to hide this folder from the public profile page, and click Save to apply any changes. Use Delete folder to remove the folder — if there are any projects inside, you will be prompted to Delete or Move them.</p>


[img w="700" h="474" f="/wp-content/uploads/Project-Folder.png" rf="/wp-content/uploads/Project-Folder@2x.png" ]
[hint title="Hint: working with folders."]
<ul>
	<li>Private folders are marked with a lock icon on your profile page.</li>
	<li>Push New Folder to create an empty folder.</li>
	<li>Click Select, pick one or more projects, switch to Delete in Move drop-down, and confirm with Delete button to remove several projects at once.</li>
	<li>If you are someone's collaborator on Readymag, all projects shared with you appear under Shared with me in a folder with the author's account Name and Userpic.</li>
	<li>Hover over this folder, and click if you want to be removed from their Teamwork collaborators.</li>
</ul>
[/hint]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>156</wp:post_id>
