	<item>
		<title>Starting a subscription</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/account-and-billing/billing-and-plans/starting-a-subscription/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 21 Nov 2017 14:24:08 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=158</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Open Subscription &amp; Billing in your profile Settings and click Upgrade button. Choose a plan, select Pay Monthly or Pay Annually billing interval, and type in your payment card details. Turn off Auto-renew control if you want to make a one-time payment. Otherwise, your subscription is renewed automatically, and recurring payments will be charged on the next billing date. Click Subscribe to confirm your payment.</p>
<p>[video src="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Starting-a-subscription-1.mp4" width="700" height="393" autoplay=on loop=on controls=off]</p>
<p>The Next Payment is automatically scheduled for one month/year from today, based on the selected billing interval. You can always check it in Subscription &amp; Billing. Payment transactions are provided and secured by Stripe widget, accepting most international and local Visa, Mastercard, American Express, and Discover cards.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>158</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2017-11-21 14:24:08]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2017-11-21 14:24:08]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[starting-a-subscription]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>157</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[card]]></wp:post_type>

	<item>
		<title>Changing plan or billing interval</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/account-and-billing/billing-and-plans/changing-plan-or-billing-interval/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 21 Nov 2017 14:24:28 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=159</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>You can change your subscription or billing interval at any time. Open Subscription &amp; Billing in your profile Settings, and click Edit Subscription button. After making any changes, click Update to confirm.</p>


[img w="700" h="474" f="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Changing-plan.png" rf="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Changing-plan@2x.png" ]

<table class="two-column-description">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td style="width: 40%;">Switching between Annual and Monthly for the same Paid Plan</td>
<td>Your current subscription is terminated, and we return unused money for the remaining period to your account balance. Then we subscribe you to the same plan, deducting your remaining account balance. Your new Next Payment date is set for one month/year from today.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="width: 40%;">Switching between Annual and Monthly for the same Paid Plan</td>
<td>Your current subscription is terminated, and we return unused money for the remaining period to your account balance. Then we subscribe you to the new plan, charging only for the days left until your scheduled Next Payment date.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="width: 40%;">Switching between different Paid Plans with the same billing interval</td>
<td>Your remaining account balance is deducted from the payment. Your Next Payment date remains the same.</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>159</wp:post_id>

		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[changing-plan-or-billing-interval]]></wp:post_name>

	<item>
		<title>Cancelling a subscription</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/account-and-billing/billing-and-plans/cancelling-a-subscription/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 21 Nov 2017 14:24:48 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=160</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>To cancel a subscription, open Subscription &amp; Billing in your profile Settings and click Cancel beneath your plan's name in Next Payment. Your current Annual/Monthly Paid Plan will be switched to Free plan at the end of the paid period. Click Downgrade button to confirm your cancellation. Read more about <a v-rlink="" href="/account-and-billing/#downgrading">Downgrading</a> below.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Receipts and payment history</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/account-and-billing/billing-and-plans/receipts-and-payment-history/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 21 Nov 2017 14:25:06 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=161</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Open Subscription &amp; Billing in the Profile Settings, where you can find all your previous payments under Purchases. Click Receipt beneath any item in the list to generate a detailed payment confirmation. Type in any additional details, if necessary, and click Get Receipt button. Your receipt opens in a new browser tab, where you can either Print or Download a PDF.</p>
<p>[video src="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Receipts-and-payment-history-.mp4" width="700" height="393" autoplay=on loop=on controls=off]</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Teamwork</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/account-and-billing/working-with-a-team/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 21 Nov 2017 14:25:33 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=162</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>On all paid plans, you can connect other Readymag accounts and give their owners access to your projects. Connected accounts are called collaborators. The number of collaborators is limited — see <a v-rlink="" href="https://readymag.com/pricing/">Pricing</a>. If you've reached the limit, contact <a v-rlink="" href="mailto:support@readymag.com">support@readymag.com</a> to increase the number of collaborators or remove some of the existing ones.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>162</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2017-11-21 14:25:33]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2017-11-21 14:25:33]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[working-with-a-team]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>21</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[card]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>

		</wp:postmeta>

			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_rm_card_attributes]]></wp:meta_key>

		</wp:postmeta>

			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[542]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Inviting a collaborator</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/account-and-billing/working-with-a-team/inviting-a-collaborator/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 21 Nov 2017 14:26:59 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=163</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>To add a collaborator, click Teamwork button on your profile page. Type in an email address and specify what to share. Share all projects means that all existing and future projects in your account will be accessible by this collaborator. Switch to select on the slide-out panel, specify one or more projects to share, and press Save if you want to give your collaborator only limited access. Click Invite to send your invitation.</p>
<p>[video src="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Inviting-a-collaborator.mp4" width="700" height="393" autoplay=on loop=on controls=off]</p>
<p><br />
 The collaborator is marked as waiting for a response until they accept your invitation sent by email. If you invite someone who doesn't have a Readymag account yet, this collaborator will be prompted to create a new account in order to access shared projects.</p>
<p>After accepting the invitation, collaborators will see your projects in a special folder with your Name and Userpic under Shared with me on their profile page. Click Teamwork to see the status of your collaborators, change the access to specific projects, or remove them at any time.</p>


[hint title="Hint: teamwork."]
<ul>
	<li>If you need to get access to your collaborator's project, the owner of the account must be on a paid plan to invite you the same way with Teamwork button.</li>
	<li>To leave any shared project, hover your cursor over the author's folder in Shared with me, click 'x', and push 'Yes'.</li>
	<li>A  number on the button indicates how many active or invited collaborators you currently have.</li>
	<li>The same number is also shown on the cover of each project you shared.</li>
</ul>
[/hint]

<p>&nbsp;</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>163</wp:post_id>

	<item>
		<title>Editing projects together</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/account-and-billing/working-with-a-team/editing-projects-together/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 21 Nov 2017 14:27:25 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=164</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Each collaborator can access a shared project at any time, edit the content and manage project settings, including Publishing. However, only one person can edit any individual page at the time. If someone is currently editing the page, you'll see the collaborator user pic on the cover in the Project Menu (M).</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Project Views</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/account-and-billing/project-views/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 21 Nov 2017 14:27:45 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=165</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>On all paid plans, a total number of Project Views per month is limited. Readymag counts every visit to a published project as a single view, including repeated views from the same visitor. Your own visits to the published project are also counted.</p>
<p>Each Project View covers the visit to the whole project, regardless of how many times the visitor switched pages back and forth within their session.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Find your Project Views</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/account-and-billing/project-views/find-your-project-views/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 21 Nov 2017 14:27:59 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=166</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>A total number of project views for the current month is shown above the list of your projects on the profile page. Make sure you're logged in. Hover your cursor over any specific project to see a number of views on it. To view a detailed report and statistics for previous months, click the number of project views.</p>


[hint title="Hint: project views are unlimited on Free plan."]
<p>&nbsp;</p>
[/hint]]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>What happens when you stop paying</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/account-and-billing/downgrading/what-happens-when-you-stop-paying/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 21 Nov 2017 14:37:23 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=170</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>To keep one of the paid plans active, your payment must be accepted on the Next Payment date shown in Subscription &amp; Billing section in your profile Settings. Readymag sends an email notification two days prior to billing date.</p>
<p>If your payment fails, you will have two more days until your subscription expires. Readymag will retry to process the payment twice with the same card credentials, one attempt per day.</p>
<p>Once your subscription expires, you are automatically downgraded to Free plan. All your published projects remain visible to the public, and we will not delete anything from your account without your permission.</p>
<p>To update your card details, click Edit Subscription button beside your Current Plan in Subscription &amp; Billing, and use Edit info underneath Payment information to make any changes. For security purposes, only expiration date and last digits of your Card Number are shown.</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>170</wp:post_id>

		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Each plan has different features and limitations, so read below what happens with every particular feature once you downgrade.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Creating pages</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/account-and-billing/downgrading/after-downgrading/downgrading-creating-pages/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 21 Nov 2017 14:38:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=172</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>You cannot add new pages to any project that already have 10 or more pages. All published projects with 10+ pages will always remain accessible to your visitors.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Teamwork</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/account-and-billing/downgrading/after-downgrading/downgrading-teamwork/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 21 Nov 2017 14:38:17 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=173</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Shared projects are no longer accessible to your collaborators. You can still see all invited collaborators in Teamwork settings. If you upgrade to one of the paid plans again, shared projects will become available to them automatically.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>173</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2017-11-21 14:38:17]]></wp:post_date>

	<item>
		<title>Custom domains</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/account-and-billing/downgrading/after-downgrading/downgrading-custom-domains/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 21 Nov 2017 14:40:01 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=178</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Published projects can only be viewed with readymag.com domain, so make sure to unmap any custom domain names:</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
<ul>
	<li>Open your Readymag profile, click Edit Profile, and go to Domain section to unmap a domain from your entire Readymag account.</li>
	<li>Open your Project Settings and click Domain tab to unmap a custom domain from a particular project.</li>
</ul>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>178</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2017-11-21 14:40:01]]></wp:post_date>

	<item>
		<title>Font Upload</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/account-and-billing/downgrading/after-downgrading/downgrading-font-upload/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 21 Nov 2017 14:40:15 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=179</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>You cannot use any uploaded fonts in your Library, or upload new WOFF files. All custom fonts remain visible in published projects. However, if you make any changes and republish the project, WOFF fonts will be replaced with system fonts.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>All custom HTML, JavaScript, and CSS code continues working in published projects, both global Project Code and Embed &amp; Code widgets. However, if you make any changes and republish the project, custom code will stop executing.</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Shortcuts</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/shortcuts/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 22 Nov 2017 14:32:33 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[wp-admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=237</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<table class="shortcuts">
<thead>
<tr>
<td colspan="2">Editor</td>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>M</td>
<td>project menu</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>W</td>
<td>add widget</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>P</td>
<td>preview</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>⌘<span class="faded">+</span>Z</td>
<td>undo action</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>⌘<span class="faded">+</span>shift<span class="faded">+</span>Z</td>
<td>redo action</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>S</td>
<td>snapping</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>H</td>
<td>guides</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>G</td>
<td>grid</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Tab</td>
<td>hide/show interface elements</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>F/V<span class="faded">+</span>drag</td>
<td>bundle drag</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<table class="shortcuts">
<thead>
<tr>
<td colspan="2">Widgets</td>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>Q</td>
<td>open widgets panel</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>⌘<span class="faded">+</span>A</td>
<td>select all</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>⌘<span class="faded">+</span>C</td>
<td>copy widget</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>⌘<span class="faded">+</span>V</td>
<td>paste widget</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>L</td>
<td>lock widget</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>R</td>
<td>rotate</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>⌘<span class="faded">+</span>G</td>
<td>group widgets</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>⌘<span class="faded">+</span>shift<span class="faded">+</span>G</td>
<td>ungroup widgets</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>⌘<span class="faded">+</span>[</td>
<td>bring backward</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>⌘<span class="faded">+</span>]</td>
<td>bring forward</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>⌘<span class="faded">+</span>alt<span class="faded">+</span>[</td>
<td>send to back</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>⌘<span class="faded">+</span>alt<span class="faded">+</span>]</td>
<td>send to front</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Backspace</td>
<td>delete widget or animation step</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Shift<span class="faded">+</span>⌘<span class="faded">+</span>C</td>
<td>copy widget’s animation effect</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Shift<span class="faded">+</span>⌘<span class="faded">+</span>V</td>
<td>paste widget’s animation effect</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<table class="shortcuts">
<thead>
<tr>
<td colspan="2">Text widget</td>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>Fn<span class="faded">+</span>enter</td>
<td>quit edit mode</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>⌘<span class="faded">+</span>shift<span class="faded">+</span>&gt;</td>
<td>increase font size</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>⌘<span class="faded">+</span>shift<span class="faded">+</span>&lt;</td>
<td>decrease font size</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Alt<span class="faded">+</span>↑</td>
<td>increase line height</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Alt<span class="faded">+</span>↓ </td>
<td>decrease line height</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Alt<span class="faded">+</span>→</td>
<td>increase letter spacing</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Alt<span class="faded">+</span>←</td>
<td>decrease letter spacing</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>⌘<span class="faded">+</span>K</td>
<td>create a link</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>⌘<span class="faded">+</span>B</td>
<td>make bold</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>⌘<span class="faded">+</span>I</td>
<td>make italic</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>⌘<span class="faded">+</span>U</td>
<td>make underlined</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>⌘<span class="faded">+</span>A</td>
<td>select all text</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>⌘<span class="faded">+</span>shift<span class="faded">+</span>A</td>
<td>select current paragraph</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>⌘<span class="faded">+</span>shift<span class="faded">+</span>L</td>
<td>align left</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>⌘<span class="faded">+</span>shift<span class="faded">+</span>R</td>
<td>align right</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>⌘<span class="faded">+</span>shift<span class="faded">+</span>C</td>
<td>align center</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>⌘<span class="faded">+</span>shift<span class="faded">+</span>X</td>
<td>fit frame to text</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<table class="shortcuts">
<thead>
<tr>
<td colspan="2">Page layouts</td>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>1</td>
<td>switch to desktop layout</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>2</td>
<td>switch to mobile layout</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Background</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/widgets/background/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 22 Nov 2017 14:40:06 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=245</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>This widget allows you to change the background of your page. The background is one of the default widgets, added automatically for every page. If you create a mobile layout of the page, a new Background widget will be added to it. Open Widgets (Q) panel on your widget bar to access it. </p>
<p>[video src="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/background.mp4" width="700" height="437" autoplay=on loop=on controls=off]</p>
<p>You can choose a solid Color, Picture or Video for your page background. Background video automatically starts playing when your page finishes loading. Use the Opacity slider for Picture and Video backgrounds to make them semi-transparent, or to combine with any solid Color.</p>
<p>Note! Background widget works independently for desktop and mobile layout.</p>


[hint title="Hint: adding pictures and videos."]
<p><br />
 See <a v-rlink="" href="http://help-test.readymag.net/editor/#picture">Picture</a> and <a v-rlink="" href="http://help-test.readymag.net/editor/#video">Video</a> widgets for more on uploading picture files and embedding videos, using built-in search, and integration with Flickr, Unsplash, YouTube, and Vimeo.</p>
[/hint]]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Embed &amp; Code</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/widgets/embed-code/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 22 Nov 2017 14:50:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=252</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>This widget supports a custom HTML, JavaScript, and CSS code for additional interactive forms, menus, styles, web analytics tools, or any customizations of your page. Click Add Widget (W) on the widget bar and select Embed &amp; Code. </p>
<p>Any third-party script will likely require additional coding to make it work since Readymag has some very sophisticated mechanisms under the hood. We recommend inviting a professional web developer to work with Code Embedding. Use any custom code, especially Use iFrame switch, at your own risk, and proceed with extreme caution — Readymag support won't be able to assist you with Embed &amp; Code issues.</p>
<p>You can also change standard Animation, Position, and Arrange attributes for your Embed &amp; Code widget.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Facebook</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/widgets/facebook/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 22 Nov 2017 14:50:30 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=253</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>If you want to let your visitors like and comment your project or page on Facebook, click Add Widget (W) on the widget bar and select Facebook. You can also use this widget to embed an existing Facebook page.</p>
<p>On Facebook, any Like button or Comments box exists only for a particular direct URL, not a website or page in general. Please make sure that you specify a correct link for all Facebook widgets, otherwise, you will have a button that appears functional, but does not trigger any Facebook social action.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<title>Grid &amp; Guides</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/widgets/grid-guides/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 22 Nov 2017 14:51:31 +0000</pubDate>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=256</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>This widget helps you to create a column layout for the page, and to position all widgets precisely. Open Widgets (Q) panel on your widget bar to access it. Grid &amp; Guides is one of the global widgets — added to your panel by default, it doesn't belong to any specific page, and works both for desktop and mobile layouts of your entire project. </p>


[img w="700" h="394" f="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Grid-_-Guides.png" rf="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Grid-_-Guides@2x.png" ]]]></content:encoded>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>You can place interactive notes anywhere on the page by adding Hotspot widgets, so your visitors will see a pop-up when they hover over the widget or click on it. To create a new note, click Add Widget (W) on the widget bar and select Hotspot.</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Music</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/widgets/music/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 22 Nov 2017 14:52:25 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=258</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>To embed an audio file on your page, click Add Widget (W) on your widget bar and select Music. You can add a single track or an artist profile from SoundCloud service. Direct upload is not supported for audio files. You can create a free SoundCloud account, upload your audio file, and then embed it through the Music widget.</p>


[img w="700" h="474" f="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Music.png" rf="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Music@2x.png" ]

<p>You can switch between Original Player, Visual Player, and Minimal layouts for your embedded SoundCloud player, hide Comments, Artwork, and standard Buy/Share buttons (Social), activate Autoplay and change Color of the interface elements.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Picture</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/widgets/picture/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 22 Nov 2017 14:52:41 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=259</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>To create a new image on the page, click Add Widget (W) on the widget bar and select Picture. You can upload an image file, paste a direct URL, or add images from Flickr, Unsplash, and built-in Bing search. You can also drag and drop any image file on the workspace to create Picture widget.</p>


[img w="700" h="474" f="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Add-picture.png" rf="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Add-picture@2x.png" ]

<p>Note! For a file upload, images in JPG, GIF, PNG, SVG and BMP formats are supported. Each file can be up to 6 MB in size.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>259</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2017-11-22 14:52:41]]></wp:post_date>

	<item>
		<title>Settings, Edit Text and Icon</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/widgets/button/settings-edit-text-and-icon/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 22 Nov 2017 14:58:20 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=269</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Click Settings in the widget controls to customize your button. You can pick rectangular, ellipse, or square shape, change the Radius, add Border, pick text style and colours. If you want your Button to change an appearance when the visitor hovers over it, switch to Hover and change default colours and Border attributes.</p>
<p>Use Edit Text control to type in text on your button. Click Icon in the widget controls to add a graphic symbol. You can change the icon size and place it on the Left or Right from the text on the button.</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Custom code on Free plan</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/widgets/embed-code/custom-code-on-free-plan/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 22 Nov 2017 15:03:59 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=272</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Custom code fully works on the Professional and Enterprise plans, as well as in Preview (P) mode on all plans — this way you can test the functionality before upgrading.</p>
<p>On the Creator and Free plans, only &lt;iframe&gt;...&lt;/ iframe&gt; tag and HTML codes for embedded Facebook videos and live videos, Instagram posts, and Pinterest boards are supported. </p>
<p>Note! If you paste an existing &lt;iframe&gt;...&lt;/ iframe&gt; code that has any other tags, such as &lt;div&gt; or &lt;script&gt;, they will be ignored on Free and Creator plans, only visible in Preview (P) mode.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>272</wp:post_id>

		<title>Code editor</title>

		<pubDate>Wed, 22 Nov 2017 15:08:49 +0000</pubDate>

		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Double-click Embed &amp; Code widget to open a code editor, where you can type in or paste the plain HTML code. Use Widget Code to run your custom code locally on the page, or switch to Project Code to create an injection for the entire project.</p>]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Clear widget contents</title>

		<pubDate>Wed, 22 Nov 2017 15:10:01 +0000</pubDate>

		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>If you want a custom code to be removed when your visitors switch to another page or window, toggle Clear widget contents control. This option allows you, for instance, to mute an auto-playing video while your project's browser tab is inactive.</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Use iFrame</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/widgets/embed-code/use-iframe/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 22 Nov 2017 15:11:11 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=277</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Custom code may not be displayed correctly in the Editor. Switch to Preview (P) mode on any plan to see if your embedded code works. If your custom code doesn't appear even in preview, toggle Use iFrame switch to enclose your injection in &lt;iframe&gt;...&lt;/iframe&gt; tag.</p>
<p>[video src="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Use-iFrame-1.mp4" width="700" height="389" autoplay=on loop=on controls=off]</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>277</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2017-11-22 15:11:11]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2017-11-22 15:11:11]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[use-iframe]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>252</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[card]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_rm_card_attributes]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[a:0:{}]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
	</item>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>This code is executed for the entire project. You can paste plain HTML code in the ◦ &lt;HEAD&gt; section, After &lt;BODY&gt;, or  Before &lt;/BODY&gt; tags.</p>]]></content:encoded>

[img w="700" h="474" f="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Three-types-of-Facebook-widget.png" rf="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Three-types-of-Facebook-widget@2x.png" ]]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Like button</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/widgets/facebook/settings/like-button/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 22 Nov 2017 15:16:10 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=284</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Specify a link that your visitors are going to like the Button. Click ‘Plus’ icon in the URL field to switch between two modes. Using the project URL means that your Like Button is going to create a Facebook like for the entire project. Using the page URL will create a Facebook like for a specific page where you placed the Button. Alternatively, you can paste or type in any direct URL in this field, and click 'Arrow' icon in the URL field to associate this link with your Like Button. You can switch between Standard, Button Count, and Box Count layouts in Settings control. </p>
<p>If you change a project's or page link, your Like Button widget will be updated automatically both by Using the project URL and Using the page URL modes. Remember — if you specify an external URL in this widget, any Facebook likes will be generated for this external link, not the page where you placed your Like Button.</p>
<p>Additional attributes include Share Button and the option to show Facebook friends' faces in the widget.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>284</wp:post_id>

	<item>
		<title>Page</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/widgets/facebook/settings/page/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 22 Nov 2017 15:17:12 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=285</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Type in or paste a direct URL of the Facebook Page to embed in your widget, e.g. https://facebook.com/randompagename. Personal accounts and Facebook groups are not supported.</p>
<p>A few additional settings are available for the Page widget:</p>
<ul>
	<li>Show Stream to display timeline, events and messages in your widget;</li>
	<li>Small Header to switch to the compact layout for your Page's header;</li>
	<li>Show Faces to display faces of those who liked this Facebook Page.</li>
</ul>]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Comments</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/widgets/facebook/settings/comments/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 22 Nov 2017 15:17:44 +0000</pubDate>

		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Add a Comments box that your visitors can use to comment on your page under their Facebook accounts. Click 'plus' icon in the URL field to switch between two modes. Using the project URL means that a Facebook comment added through your widget will be associated with the entire project. Using the page URL will create a Facebook comment associated with a specific page. </p>
<p>You can also change the number of posts to display within Comments widget.</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Fields</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/widgets/form/fields/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 22 Nov 2017 16:13:45 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=288</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>You can add six different types of fields to your Form. By default, all fields must be completed by the visitor — use the Optional Field switch to make any of them non-mandatory.</p>
<ul>
	<li><strong>Text.</strong> Accepts any text.</li>
	<li><strong>Number.</strong> Accepts only digits and decimal points: dot [.] and comma [,].</li>
	<li><strong>Name.</strong> Use this field to save your visitor’s name to Mailchimp. Accepts any text.</li>
	<li><strong>Email.</strong> Accepts email addresses in any.text1.23@example.com format. This field is required to send data to Mailchimp. <br />
 Please, note that email field doesn’t have validity check, so wrong addresses, typos, and non-existent domains will be accepted and saved.</li>
	<li><strong>Phone number.</strong> Accepts phone numbers in the following format: +[country code][area code][subscriber number] (plus is optional). Spaces and hyphens may be typed in as separators. For instance, +12221234567, or 7 415 123-45-67.</li>
	<li><strong>Dropdown.</strong> Creates a dropdown list of multiple choices. This is a two-level control  —  click Dropdown in the Fields control to pull out the enclosed panel where you can add, delete, and rearrange each field.</li>
</ul>


[img w="700" h="474" f="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Six-different-types-of-fields.png" rf="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Six-different-types-of-fields@2x.png" ]
[hint title="Hint: the optional text."]
<p>The ‘optional’ text, displayed with Optional Field switch on, is only visible to you in the Editor. Your visitors are not going to see it in the published project.</p>
[/hint]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>288</wp:post_id>

		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[fields]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>254</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[card]]></wp:post_type>

		<title>Styles</title>

		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Click Styles in the widget controls to switch between vertical and horizontal layout for your Form, choose a Colored, Outlined, or Underlined scheme, and change Fields and Button attributes: spacing, colour, radius, border, text style, and so on.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>296</wp:post_id>

	<item>
		<title>Send Data</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/widgets/form/send-data/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 22 Nov 2017 16:23:04 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=297</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Click Send Data to choose one of the four options for storing submitted data.</p>
<ul>
	<li><strong>Email.</strong> Sends all submitted data to the Current Email in your Readymag account. Other addresses are not supported. This is a default option for newly created Forms.</li>
	<li><strong>Google.</strong> Saves each submitted form as a new row in Google Sheets document. Type in a name for the new spreadsheet, and it will be automatically created in the root folder of your connected Google Drive account.</li>
	<li><strong>Mailchimp.</strong> Adds a subscriber to one of your MailChimp lists. Email field in the Form is required to save submitted data.</li>
	<li><strong>URL.</strong> Sends all submitted forms to a custom URL. The data is transferred via POST request in application/x-www-form-urlencoded format. To rearrange fields in your Form, click and drag one of them vertically in the Fields control. If you want to receive submitted data to a different email or multiple addresses, use your email provider’s automatic forwarding to filter and redirect New form submission letters from Readymag.</li>
</ul>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>297</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2017-11-22 16:23:04]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2017-11-22 16:23:04]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[send-data]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>254</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[card]]></wp:post_type>

	<item>
		<title>Supported browsers</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/supported-browsers/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 23 Nov 2017 09:43:28 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[wp-admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=306</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<h4 class="single-page__header-4">Browsers recommended for editing</h4>
<ul>
	<li>Safari 7.0+</li>
	<li>Chrome latest versions</li>
	<li>Opera latest versions</li>
	<li>Firefox latest versions</li>
</ul>
<h4 class="single-page__header-4">Supported browsers</h4>
<p>In these browsers, visitors can view projects created with Readymag.</p>
<p>Desktop:</p>
<ul>
	<li>Safari 6.1+</li>
	<li>Chrome latest versions</li>
	<li>Opera latest versions</li>
	<li>Firefox latest versions</li>
	<li>Internet Explorer 10+</li>
	<li>Microsoft Edge latest</li>
</ul>
<p>iOS 8.0 and later:</p>
<ul>
	<li>Safari</li>
	<li>Chrome</li>
	<li>Firefox</li>
</ul>
<p>Android 6 and later:</p>
<ul>
	<li>Chrome 62.0+</li>
</ul>
<p>Note! Google Chrome for Android 61.0 and earlier versions don’t support vertical scrolling. All projects will have horizontal scrolling by default.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>306</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2017-11-23 09:43:28]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2017-11-23 09:43:28]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[supported-browsers]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[card]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[2]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_rm_card_attributes]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[a:1:{s:12:"default_page";s:3:"302";}]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Custom Analytics API</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/custom-analytics-api/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 23 Nov 2017 12:14:10 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[wp-admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=311</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[img w="508" h="74" f="/wp-content/uploads/warning.png" rf="/wp-content/uploads/warning@2x.png" ]

<p>We send the data about all interactions in a project to your Google Analytics property by default. In addition to that, you can add other analytics trackers and specify which events will be sent to them using their API calls.</p>
<h4 class="single-page__header-4">Add custom tracker</h4>
<p>Follow the instructions of an analytics service of your choice to obtain its tracking code. Usually, the code should be placed into the &lt;head&gt; section.</p>
<p>See <a v-rlink="" href="/project-settings-and-publishing/#embed-custom-code">Code Embedding</a></p>
<h4 class="single-page__header-4">Set up API calls to track events</h4>
<p>The global object RM.customAnalyticsHandlers contains two arrays:</p>
<ol>
	<li>RM.customAnalyticsHandlers.event — the array of functions that handle the events on pages. Each time a visitor triggers an event on a page all the functions in this array are executed.</li>
	<li>RM.customAnalyticsHandlers.track — the array of functions that handle transitions between pages. Each time a visitor goes to another a page in a project all the functions in this array are executed.</li>
</ol>
<p>Functions that you add to the arrays are called with an object containing tracking parameters in a format that Google Analytics accepts. Modify the object according to specifications of your analytics tool and send it using its API call.</p>


[img w="700" h="300" f="/wp-content/uploads/custom-analytics-sample-700x300.png" rf="/wp-content/uploads/custom-analytics-sample-700x300@2x.png" ]
[hint title="Sample code"]
<p>&nbsp;</p>
[/hint]

<h4 class="single-page__header-4">Example</h4>
<p>Let’s say, we are using Kissmetrics in addition to Google Analytics.<br />
 Here’s a piece of code that sends data to my Kissmetrics account each time visitors submit a form on the page '/5':</p>


[img w="700" h="300" f="/wp-content/uploads/cusotm-analytics-example-1-700x300.png" rf="/wp-content/uploads/cusotm-analytics-example-1-700x300@2x.png" ]

<p>In addition, I would like to track visits to the pages '/contact' and '/buy':</p>


[img w="700" h="300" f="/wp-content/uploads/custom-analytics-example-2.png" rf="/wp-content/uploads/custom-analytics-example-2@2x.png" ]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>311</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2017-11-23 12:14:10]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2017-11-23 12:14:10]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[custom-analytics-api]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[card]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>

			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_rm_card_attributes]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[a:1:{s:12:"default_page";s:3:"309";}]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
	</item>
	<item>
		<title>List of events</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/custom-analytics-api/list-of-events/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 23 Nov 2017 13:01:34 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[wp-admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=318</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Below is the list of actions that we track by default. A sample of an argument for the functions — 'params' object — is provided below each event.</p>
<h4 class="single-page__header-4">Page view</h4>
<p>Add functions to 'track' array.</p>
<p>[code]<code class="block">{ "page": "/dps/556542",
  "location": "https://test.readymag.net/dps/556542/",
  "screenName": "Test" }</code>[/code]</p>

<h4 class="single-page__header-4">Clicks on external links</h4>
<p>[code]<code class="block">{ "hitType": "event",
  "eventCategory": "Project Actions",
  "eventAction": "External Link",
  "eventLabel": "http://readymag.com",
  "page": "/dps/556542",
  "location": "https://test.readymag.net/dps/556542/",
  "screenName": "Test" }</code>[/code]</p>

<h4 class="single-page__header-4">Clicks on anchor links</h4>
<p>[code]<code class="block">{ "hitType": "event",
  "eventCategory": "Project Actions",
  "eventAction": "Anchor Link",
  "eventLabel": 652,
  "page": "/dps/556542",
  "location": "https://test.readymag.net/dps/556542/",
  "screenName": "Test" }</code>[/code]</p>

<h4 class="single-page__header-4">Clicks on ‘scroll top’ links</h4>
<p>[code]<code class="block">{ "hitType": "event",
  "eventCategory": "Project Actions",
  "eventAction": "Scroll Top Link",
  "page": "/dps/556542",
  "location": "https://test.readymag.net/dps/556542/",
  "screenName": "Test" }</code>[/code]</p>

<h4 class="single-page__header-4">Form is submitted</h4>
<p>[code]<code class="block">{ "hitType": "event",
  "eventCategory": "Project Actions",
  "eventAction": "Form Submit Click",
  "page": "/dps/556542/page-url",
  "location": "https://test.readymag.net/dps/556542/page-url/",
  "screenName": "Test" }</code>[/code]</p>

<h4 class="single-page__header-4">Clicks on ‘go back’ links</h4>
<p>[code]<code class="block">{ "hitType": "event",
  "eventCategory": "Project Actions",
  "eventAction": "Back Link",
  "page": "/dps/556542/page-url",
  "location": "https://test.readymag.net/dps/556542/page-url/",
  "screenName": "Test" }</code>[/code]</p>

<h4 class="single-page__header-4">Hotspot hovers</h4>
<p>[code]<code class="block">{ "hitType": "event",
  "eventCategory": "Project Actions",
  "eventAction": "Hotspot Hover",
  "page": "/dps/556542/page-url",
  "location": "https://test.readymag.net/dps/556542/page-url/",
  "screenName": "Test" }</code>[/code]</p>

<h4 class="single-page__header-4">Hotspot clicks</h4>
<p>[code]<code class="block">{ "hitType": "event",
  "eventCategory": "Project Actions",
  "eventAction": "Hotspot Click",
  "page": "/dps/556542/page-url",
  "location": "https://test.readymag.net/dps/556542/page-url/",
  "screenName": "Test" }</code>[/code]</p>

<h4 class="single-page__header-4">Video starts playing</h4>
<p>[code]<code class="block">{ "hitType": "event",
  "eventCategory": "Project Actions",
  "eventAction": "Video Play",
  "eventLabel": "Readymag — Product Video / https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VFo5Z8Y3JjQ",
  "page": "/dps/556542/page-url",
  "location": "https://test.readymag.net/dps/556542/page-url/",
  "screenName": "Test" }</code>[/code]</p>

<h4 class="single-page__header-4">Video stops playing</h4>
<p>[code]<code class="block">{ "hitType": "event",
  "eventCategory": "Project Actions",
  "eventAction": "Video Pause",
  "eventLabel": "Readymag — Product Video / https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VFo5Z8Y3JjQ",
  "eventValue": 4,
  "page": "/dps/556542/page-url",
  "location": "https://test.readymag.net/dps/556542/page-url/",
  "screenName": "Test" }</code>[/code]</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Sets and settings</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/widgets/grid-guides/sets-and-settings/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 23 Nov 2017 14:28:18 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=322</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>You can switch between existing Sets and change any individual margins within each of them. Use keyboard shortcuts to show Grid (G), Guides (H), and activate Snap (S) and Sizes (X) functions.</p>
<p>When you activate Snap, any widget you drag is always aligned with grid lines.</p>
<p>Sizes (X) allows you to see the dimensions of any selected widget, and change them in the Editor by specifying width/height in pixels instead of dragging the widget's boundaries.</p>]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Pin</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/widgets/hotspot/pin-and-tip-settings/pin/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 23 Nov 2017 14:33:29 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=325</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Pin indicates a 'hotspot' that your visitors interact with in order to see a pop-up Tip window. You can pick any symbol for your Pin (similar to the <a v-rlink="" href="/editor/#shapes-icons">Icons widget</a>), change the colour, add Border, and switch between Show on Click or Hover.</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Tip</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/widgets/hotspot/pin-and-tip-settings/tip/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 23 Nov 2017 14:34:30 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=326</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>You can change the position and colour of the Tip, add radius and turn off shadow for your pop-up window. Use Text, Image, or both in your Tip. Use Add Pin in your widgets control to create identical Hotspots without returning to the widget bar. Animation, Position, Arrange, and other general attributes applied to the Hotspot widget change the appearance of both Pin and Tip.</p>]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Basic editing</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/widgets/picture/basic-editing/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 23 Nov 2017 14:43:53 +0000</pubDate>

		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Click on the Picture to access widget controls on the right side. You can add Border, Radius, and change the Opacity under Settings, and use Crop and Actual size / Half size controls, as well as the standard Rotation, for simple editing tasks.</p>


[img w="700" h="539" f="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Basic-editing.png" rf="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Basic-editing@2x.png" ]

<p>To stretch your picture along the screen, select Full-Width position under Position in your widget controls. The height of the full-width picture always remains constant.</p>]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Frontpage</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 31 Oct 2017 10:43:52 +0000</pubDate>

									<g transform="translate(31.200000, 31.200000)">
										<path d="M53.6254752,23.9552732 C56.4727638,24.3763268 56.3864824,26.7162804 56.3864824,26.7162804 L56.3864824,30.8543399 C56.3864824,30.8543399 56.4727638,33.1942935 53.6254752,33.6153471 	<item>
		<title>Image replacement</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/widgets/picture/image-replacement/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 23 Nov 2017 15:14:08 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=333</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>There are three ways to replace an added picture:</p>
<ol>
	<li>Click on the Picture icon in the Picture widget control and choose a file.

<p>[video src="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/imagereplacement_1-1.mp4" width="700" height="390" autoplay=on loop=on controls=off]</p>
</li>
	<li>Drag and drop a new image directly to the Picture icon in the Picture widget control.

<p>[video src="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/imagereplacement_2-2.mp4" width="700" height="390" autoplay=on loop=on controls=off]</p>
</li>
	<li>Drag and drop a new image over the old one.

<p>[video src="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/imagereplacement_3-1.mp4" width="700" height="390" autoplay=on loop=on controls=off]</p>
</li>
</ol>
<p>&nbsp;</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>333</wp:post_id>

		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[image-replacement]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>259</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[card]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[2]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_rm_card_attributes]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[a:0:{}]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Image optimization</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/widgets/picture/image-optimization/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 23 Nov 2017 15:36:22 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=340</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>When you upload an image, Editor automatically compresses it to the actual size of the widget and preserves a higher resolution version for Retina-like displays. This way, a published project with optimized image files loads faster for most of your visitors, while anyone with a Retina Display or similar screen with high PPI density sees a larger image within the same Picture widget.</p>


[hint title="Hint: upload high-resolution images."]
<p>We always recommend uploading high-resolution versions of all your images — at least twice the intended size of the widget. You can quickly scale it down by hovering over 1:1 icon and selecting 1:2 in the Actual size/Half size control. Click 1:1 to return to the original size.</p>
[/hint]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>340</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2017-11-23 15:36:22]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2017-11-23 15:36:22]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[image-optimization]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>259</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[card]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_rm_card_attributes]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[a:0:{}]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_oembed_0e899e239952dd25ccd35bcc83b2203b]]></wp:meta_key>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Settings</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/widgets/shapes-icons/settings/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 23 Nov 2017 16:06:56 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=344</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>You can change various attributes of your Shape in the widget controls on the right side: add Borders, change Radius, add up to 30 sides for the Polygon, and change Weight and Stroke for Line.</p>


[img w="700" h="474" f="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Settings.png" rf="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Settings@2x.png" ]

<p>&nbsp;</p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Icons</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/widgets/shapes-icons/icons/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 23 Nov 2017 16:19:21 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=346</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>In addition to four basic Shapes, you can add Icons on your page. Select 'Duck' icon in the Settings, pick one of the icons from the list or search for more symbols. </p>
<p>You can also add icons to the <a v-rlink="" href="/editor/#button">Button widget</a>.</p>


[img w="700" h="474" f="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Icons.png" rf="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Icons@2x.png" ]]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Slideshow settings</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/widgets/slideshow/slideshow-settings/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 23 Nov 2017 16:26:43 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=350</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Our Slideshow widget flips the pictures back and forth and has a Fullscreen mode that you can turn off in Settings in your widget controls. Additionally, you can activate Thumbnails, Autoplay, use Fill to stretch images to the full size of the widget, and change the colour of controls and background.</p>


[img w="700" h="474" f="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Slideshow-settings.png" rf="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Slideshow-settings@2x.png" ]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Captions</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/widgets/slideshow/captions/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 23 Nov 2017 16:27:57 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=352</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>You can switch between Classic and With Captions themes in your slideshow Settings. Once you activate captions, an additional text field will appear underneath the widget, where you can add a description of each image. Additionally, you can switch off Counters, and access standard Typography, Font Style, and Color controls for your captions — they will automatically appear in the widget's controls.</p>


[img w="700" h="474" f="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Caption.png" rf="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Caption@2x.png" ]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Editing and Styles</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/widgets/text/editing-and-styles/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 23 Nov 2017 16:30:26 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=354</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Click Text widget once to see general settings in the widget controls on the right side: Animation, Rotation, Position, and Arrange. Click Edit, or double-click Text widget, to access text properties, such as Styles and Font Style, Typography, and Align. You can also add Links, change Color, and split the text into Сolumns. <br />
 <br />
 To add a text style, e.g. Header or Caption, highlight any fragment and use Styles in the widget controls. Click beside a style's title, and use Edit Style to change a Font Size, Color, Line Height, and Tracking for your style, as well as set indents using Margins control. Click Save to apply any changes. </p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>354</wp:post_id>

	<item>
		<title>Fonts</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/widgets/text/fonts/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 23 Nov 2017 16:34:44 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=355</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>To add fonts from Adobe Typekit, Webtype, Google Fonts, and type.today collections to your project click Typography in the widget controls, select Custom tab in Fonts drop-down, and click Library. </p>
<p>On paid plans, you can upload custom fonts in WOFF format to your Library. Click Upload on the Custom tab in Fonts dropdown, type in a name for your font, pick the weight, and upload a file. Please note, you must have a proper license to use any copyright protected fonts.</p>


[img w="700" h="474" f="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Fonts.png" rf="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Fonts@2x.png" ]

<p>Additionally, you can use <a v-rlink="" href="/project-settings-and-publishing/#google-tag-manager/">Google Tag Manager </a>to add tracking code from your font provider. This feature is available only for projects with a custom domain name. </p>
<p>Note! All Adobe Typekit fonts are replaced by default system fonts when you export the project to PDF or HTML (due to the license restrictions).</p>


[hint title="Hint: double-click Text widget to directly access text properties."]
<p>&nbsp;</p>
[/hint]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>

	<item>
		<title>Embed Timeline or Tweet</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/widgets/twitter/embed-timeline-or-tweet/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 23 Nov 2017 16:50:05 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=360</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Use Embed Tweet and User Timeline widgets to embed an existing Twitter profile or quote a particular tweet on your page. Click Settings in the widget controls, and paste HTML code. Follow <a v-rlink href="https://dev.twitter.com/web/embedded-tweets">How to embed</a> to read about code formatting in Twitter Developer Documentation. </p>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Settings</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/widgets/video/settings/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 23 Nov 2017 16:56:46 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=363</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>You can activate Autoplay, Loop, and Show Info settings, as well as mute your Video under Settings in the widget controls. For clips from Vimeo, you can additionally change the colour of the title and video player controls.</p>


[img w="700" h="474" f="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Video-settings.png" rf="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/Video-settings@2x.png" ]

<p>Note! You cannot hide or further customize a play button, timeline bar, and other interface elements of the video player. Use <a v-rlink="" href="/editor/#embed-code">Embed &amp; Code</a> widget for further customization.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Settings</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/editor/widgets/google-maps/settings/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 23 Nov 2017 16:59:15 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=365</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Choose the Standard Map, Directions, or the Custom Map for your widget. In the Directions mode, you can specify a route for driving, bicycling, or walking. Custom Map allows you to paste JSON code, which you can easily generate with Google Maps API built-in tool — click Launch Maps Wizard link to open it.<br />
 <br />
 Turn off Controls switch to hide map controls available for your visitors inside the widget.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>365</wp:post_id>

	<item>
		<title>Edit map</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/edit-map/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 23 Nov 2017 16:59:40 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=366</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>To pick the location you want to show on Google Maps, click pin icon in widget controls. Once your widget is in Edit mode, use the search bar or drag the map to find an address. You can also set the zoom level, switch between Map and Satellite view, and turn the Labels and Terrain off.</p>
<p>For the Directions widget, you can set the origin and destination points in Edit mode.</p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>366</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2017-11-23 16:59:40]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2017-11-23 16:59:40]]></wp:post_date_gmt>

		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[card]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>

			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[2]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>

			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[a:0:{}]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Code Export</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/code-export/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 24 Nov 2017 14:13:46 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[wp-admin]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=370</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[img w="508" h="74" f="/wp-content/uploads/warning.png" rf="/wp-content/uploads/warning@2x.png" ]

<p>You can download the source code of any project to host it on your own servers. The process takes three steps:</p>
<ol>
	<li>download the source code,</li>
	<li>upload it to a remove server,</li>
	<li>configure the server.</li>
</ol>
<p>Please, note that projects will not work without the third step — if you simply upload them without configuring the server.</p>


[hint title="Note: known limitations"]
<ul>
	<li>Typekit fonts will not work if you open a project from a file on your device. </li>
	<li>Readymag Form widget can only send data to a <a v-rlink="" href="/editor/#send-data">custom URL</a>. Google Docs, Email and Mailchimp options will not work in exported projects.</li>
	<li>Custom OG tags and SEO tags are not exported for any page except the first one (meta tags stored in index.html).</li>
	<li>Exported projects cannot be changed. The content is encoded in JSON format and rendered on a page via javascript. If you need to make changes, find the project in your account, make changes, republish and export again.</li>
</ul>
[/hint]

<h4 class="single-page__header-4">Step 1: download the source code</h4>
<p>To get project’s source code you need to publish it first. The download link appears in the settings. Specify the domain where the project will be hosted in the dialog box. This is necessary for third-party integrations to work (like Typekit webfonts).</p>


[img w="700" h="605" f="/wp-content/uploads/settings_export.png" rf="/wp-content/uploads/settings_export@2x.png" ]

<h4 class="single-page__header-4">Step 2: upload the archive to a remote server</h4>
<p>In the downloaded archive you’ll find the following files and folders:</p>
<table class="two-column-description">
<thead>
<tr>
<td style="width: 20%;">File</td>
<td>Description</td>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td style="width: 20%;">robots.txt</td>
<td>pre-defined settings for web crawlers</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="width: 20%;">build </td>
<td>stylesheets, templates and scripts</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="width: 20%;">img </td>
<td>all images used in the project</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="width: 20%;">snippets </td>
<td>static contents of all pages for search crawlers</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="width: 20%;">index.html </td>
<td>project page, contains the content of the project encoded in JSON format</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="width: 20%;">sitemap.xml </td>
<td>list of available links for search crawlers</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="width: 20%;">sorry.html </td>
<td>custom page for unsupported browsers</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="width: 20%;">nginx_rmwebsite.conf </td>
<td>sample configuration file for NGINX servers </td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="width: 20%;">.htaccess </td>
<td>sample configuration file for Apache servers </td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p>Folders, containing project assets (build, img, snippets), and index.html are required. Other files can be omitted if you don’t need them.</p>
<h4 class="single-page__header-4">Step 3: configure your server</h4>
<p>We provide sample configuration settings for NGINX and Apache servers.</p>
<p>[code]<code class="block">server {
    listen          80; 
    server_name     nightcities.readymag.com;
<br />
    # Change path to folder with downloaded source
    root            "/path/to/project_folder";
<br />
    
    index           index.html;
<br />
    access_log      off;
    autoindex       off;
    charset         utf-8;
<br />
    location / {
        if (-f $request_filename ) { break; }
<br />
        if ($args ~ "_escaped_fragment_") {
            rewrite ^/([.a-zA-Z0-9-]+)/? /snippets/$1.html last;
            rewrite ^/ /snippets/1.html last;
        }
<br />
        
        location = / {
            if ($args ~ "_escaped_fragment_") {
                rewrite ^/ /snippets/1.html last;
            }            
        }
<br />
        rewrite ^/?$ /index.html last;
        rewrite ^/[.a-zA-Z0-9-]+(/(.*))? /$2 last;
<br />
        try_files $uri $uri/; 

    }
}</code>[/code]</p>
<p>[code]<code class="block">Options FollowSymLinks SymLinksIfOwnerMatch
<br />
AddDefaultCharset utf-8
<br />
AddType application/vnd.ms-fontobject eot
AddType font/opentype otf
AddType font/truetype ttf
<br />
AddType application/font-woff woff
AddType video/webm webm
<br />
RewriteEngine On
RewriteBase /
<br />
RewriteCond %{QUERY_STRING} _escaped_fragment_
RewriteCond %{REQUEST_URI} !^/(build|img|snippets|config)
RewriteRule ^([.a-zA-Z0-9-]+) snippets/$1.html [L]
<br />
RewriteCond %{QUERY_STRING} _escaped_fragment_
RewriteCond %{REQUEST_URI} !^/(build|img|snippets|config)
RewriteRule ^ snippets/1.html [L]
<br />
RewriteCond %{REQUEST_URI} !^/(build|img|snippets|config)
RewriteRule ^/?$ index.html [QSA,L]
<br />
RewriteCond %{REQUEST_URI} !^/(build|img|snippets|config)
RewriteCond %{REQUEST_FILENAME} !-f
RewriteRule ^[.a-zA-Z0-9-]+(/(.*))? $2 [QSA,N]</code>[/code]</p>
<h4 class="single-page__header-4">How it works</h4>
<p>Below is the explanation of how routing works in Readymag projects. All paths in the code are relative: your server needs to be configured to serve them.</p>


[img w="700" h="579" f="/wp-content/uploads/export.png" rf="/wp-content/uploads/export@2x.png" ]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>370</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2017-11-24 14:13:46]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2017-11-24 14:13:46]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[code-export]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[card]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
		<wp:postmeta>
			<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_rm_card_attributes]]></wp:meta_key>
			<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[a:1:{s:12:"default_page";s:3:"304";}]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
	</item>
	<item>
		<title>To enable an SSL Certificate please follow these steps</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/project-settings-and-publishing/use-custom-domain-name/ssl-certificate/enable-an-ssl-certificate/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 29 Nov 2017 20:12:02 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://help-test.readymag.net/?post_type=card&#038;p=438</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<ol>
	<li>Click on Domain tab in your Project Settings and make sure you have a mapped custom domain name.<br />
[img w="700" h="474" f="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/ssl_off.png" rf="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/ssl_off@2x.png" ]</li>
	<li>Toggle SSL switch. Wait a little.<br />
[img w="700" h="474" f="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/ssl_loading.png" rf="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/ssl_loading@2x.png" ]</li>
	<li>Your account or project and all the links inside will be automatically switched from http to https.<br />
[img w="700" h="474" f="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/ssl_on.png" rf="http://help-test.readymag.net/wp-content/uploads/ssl_on@2x.png" ]</li>
</ol>
<p class="paragraph-0a98ab9e-6e20-411f-90ed-7345d00c47d5">Please note, there are some limitations:</p>
<ul>
	<li class="paragraph-0a98ab9e-6e20-411f-90ed-7345d00c47d5">if you decide to migrate back from https to http, then you have to rewrite all links manually;</li>
	<li class="paragraph-0a98ab9e-6e20-411f-90ed-7345d00c47d5">if you use links inside &lt;iframe&gt; make sure that they have the same protocol as your domain;</li>
	<li class="paragraph-0a98ab9e-6e20-411f-90ed-7345d00c47d5">in some countries, https is slow due to local limitations.</li>
</ul>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Certification Authority Authorization (CAA)</title>
		<link>https://help.readymag.com/card/project-settings-and-publishing/use-custom-domain-name/ssl-certificate/certification-authority-authorization-caa/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 21 Dec 2017 09:49:23 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[anna]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://help.readymag.com/?post_type=card&#038;p=563</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>SSL certificates for domains are issued by Let’s Encrypt. If you restrict the list of organizations that can issue a certificate for your custom domain, you need to <a v-rlink="" href="https://letsencrypt.org/docs/caa/">add</a> letsencrypt.org to the list of Certificate Authorities (CAs). </p>


[hint title="Example: example.org. CAA 1 issue “letsencrypt.org”"]
<p>&nbsp;</p>
[/hint]]]></content:encoded>
